Definition: In this task, you will receive two phrases: Head and Tail, separated with <sep>. The Head and the Tail events are short phrases possibly involving participants. You have to determine whether, as a result of the Head, the subject of the event (PersonX) will be affected as mentioned in the Tail. These effects are social actions that may occur after the Head event. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No". The phrase may also contain "___", a placeholder that can be an object, a person, and/or an action.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX goes ___ with some friends<sep>Tail: spends too much money
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. As a result of the Head, PersonX will spend too much money.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX achieves ___ by means<sep>Tail: hardworking
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, if PersonX achieves something by means, PersonX is not hardworking. So this output is correct.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX is allergic to bees<sep>Tail: MUST TAKE CORRESPONDING SAFETY PRECAUTIONS
Positive Examples.explanation: If PersonX is allergic to bees, personX must take corresponding safety precautions. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX asks PersonY to go<sep>Tail: goes somewhere else
Negative Examples.explanation: If PersonX asks PersonY to go, PersonX won't go somewhere else. So the output should be "No".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX eats red meat<sep>Tail: gets meat stuck in teeth
Negative Examples.explanation: If PersonX eats red meat, the meat will be stuck in PersonX's teeth, and the output should be "Yes".

Instances.input: Head: PersonX becomes PersonY wife<sep>Tail: Caring
Head: PersonX leads PersonY to the conclusion<sep>Tail: wants to see what they say about it
Head: PersonX comes ___ to dinner<sep>Tail: PersonX falls asleep from tiredness of eating food
